item.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
item.description: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison
item.description: Emails contained in the Epstein files show former British royal Sarah Ferguson told the convicted child sex offender she knew a "single" woman with a "great body" he should meet, weeks after his 2009 release from prison.

item.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
item.description: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

item.title: Dr Karl's How Things Work quiz: How much do you really know about guitars?
item.description: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
item.description: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

item.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
item.description: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

item.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
item.description: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

item.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
item.description: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

item.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
item.description: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

item.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
item.description: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

item.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

item.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
item.description: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
item.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

item.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Ex-prince Andrew leaves Windsor home as British police investigate latest Epstein revelations
item.description: British police are investigating Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor after new files suggest Jeffrey Epstein arranged for a woman to have sex with the former prince at his home at the Royal Lodge in 2010.

item.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
item.description: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?
item.description: The Winter Olympics gets underway in Milan Cortina this week — but how much do you know about the Winter Olympics? Test yourself in our fiendish quiz.

item.title: Mother shares concerns about treatment at Toowoomba Hospital amid culture review
item.description: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
item.description: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

item.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?
item.description: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

item.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: How Super Bowl-bound Aussie Michael Dickson became NFL's best punter
item.description: Michael Dickson has become one of the finest punters in the NFL, and could become just the second Australian to play in a victorious Super Bowl team.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.title: Old Spirit ferries up sale with new berth 'on track' for October launch, TT-Line says
item.description: Ferry operator TT-Line is confident its two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels will begin operating by October — but it says there is a "risk" its existing ships might not be sold by then.

item.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
item.description: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

item.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
item.description: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

item.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
item.description: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

item.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
item.description: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

item.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Alleged attempted murder victim gives evidence in Shaun Michael Dunk trial
item.description: A woman who was stabbed multiple times in an alleged attack which killed her colleague at an Adelaide real estate office tells a court of her “fight for life”. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
item.description: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
item.description: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

item.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
item.description: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

item.title: World Anti-Doping Agency bosses 'will look at' claims of penis enlargement in ski jumping
item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

item.title: State coroner recommends NSW government adopt Escape. Hide. Tell awareness campaign
item.description: The recommendation was one of 23 handed down on Thursday as part of the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings.

item.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
item.description: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

item.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online
item.description: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

item.title: NFL confirms Los Angeles Rams vs San Francisco 49ers in Australia at the MCG
item.description: The first regular-season NFL match played on Australian shores has been confirmed as a clash between division rivals.

item.title: Voters in David Littleproud's seat of Maranoa weigh in amid Coalition split, One Nation surge
item.description: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

item.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
item.description: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook writes letter to 13yo hero swimmer Austin Appelbee
item.description: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

item.title: Magnetic fields, psychedelics and ketamine helping to treat the brain
item.description: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

item.title: Demersal fishing reforms drive fish and chip price rise on WA's south coast
item.description: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

item.title: Queensland Jewish leader wants stronger crackdown on symbols, flags, and slogans in wake of Bondi attack
item.description: Queensland Jewish Board of Deputies president Jason Steinberg has called on the state government to ramp up anti-hate laws in the wake of last year's Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Beyond the Songs Inside: After the applause
item.description: Creative prison programs are celebrated for their ability to heal and transform incarcerated people. But are they enough to break the cycle?

item.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Plenty of barramundi expected to be caught this year after Queensland's wild weather
item.description: Commercial fishers are hopeful for an abundance of barramundi after heavy rainfall from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji on the east coast and ongoing flooding in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane talks Chris Minns, polls, slogan bans and Bondi
item.description: The leader of the NSW opposition says the trait behind Premier Chris Minns's popularity is also his greatest weakness, declaring the Coalition is "absolutely in the game" to win next year's state election.

item.title: Australia's surging expectations at the Winter Olympics come thanks to Geoff Henke's strident advocacy
item.description: Australia is hoping Milano Cortina 2026 will be its most successful Winter Olympics in history. The reason for Australia's winter sports surge has its roots in a 70-year-old snubbing.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to form into category two system in WA
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has a high chance of forming into a category two system, bringing destructive winds and heavy rain to northern WA.

item.title: Brodie Jake Dewar faces upgraded charge of manslaughter after Labor identity Tim Picton's death
item.description: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns says Newcastle Writers Festival 'crazy' to invite author Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

item.title: Handful of residents remain in Daly River amid impending major flooding, as hundreds evacuated to Darwin
item.description: Some long-term residents have decided to stay behind in Daly River to help amid impending major flooding, after more than 200 people were evacuated to Darwin.

item.title: Queensland's free influenza vaccine program to return this year with nasal spray for children aged two to five
item.description: The program — which will run from March to September — will provide free flu vaccinations, including a nasal spray option for children aged two to five years.

item.title: RecipeTin Eats' Nagi Maehashi is normalising taking time off for pets. Here's why that matters.
item.description: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

item.title: Man faces court charged with possessing extremist material after phone search at Brisbane Airport
item.description: Police allege a 25-year-old man intercepted at Brisbane International Airport had violent extremist material on his phone, after an investigation into an alleged Nazi flag delivery to the man.

item.title: Bullock says government spending not sole factor pushing inflation higher as political fight heats up
item.description: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

item.title: Sarah Snook, The Newsreader and Bring Her Back triumph at AACTA Awards — as it happened
item.description: Australia's answer to the Oscars — the AACTAs — lit up the Gold Coast tonight, with horror Bring Her Back and The Narrow Road to the Deep North dominating.

item.title: Student allegedly raped by Hobart teacher in 1980s disclosed concerns, court told
item.description: A student who was allegedly raped by a Hobart teacher in the 1980s was told to focus on her studies after raising concerns with the teacher's behaviour, a court has heard.

item.title: Accused murderer Shaun Michael Dunk told police he wanted to kill 'a few people', court hears
item.description: A recorded police interview reveals that a man accused of killing a woman at a real estate business in Adelaide was not satisfied with his alleged murder.

item.title: Evidence concludes in inquest into psychiatric patient's death at Alice Springs Hospital
item.description: A coronial inquest has heard that the death of a 34-year-old mother who was repeatedly sedated during a schizophrenic episode was "entirely preventable".

item.title: AACTA 2026 winners list: Gory horror wins best film, Jacob Elordi drama dominates TV
item.description: Directors Danny and Michael Philippou clean up at the 2026 AACTA awards, taking home 10 statues for their chilling horror film Bring Her Back.

item.title: Daisy Thomas, competing without an ACL, suffers heavy crash at Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.title: Budget reform is back as Labor shapes second term agenda
item.description: As the opposition and government wrestled in the hay barn over who's to blame for this week's Reserve Bank interest rate increase, there's a much bigger story unfolding in the wings.

item.title: Albanese's invitation to Herzog is a shift in his approach to Israel
item.description: Unravelling the threads of antisemitism and anti-Israeli sentiment will require both more political courage and more community tolerance than we have seen to date.

item.title: Former ambassador Ian Kemish writes about Europe's 'forgotten' war in debut novel Two Islands
item.description: Former ambassador Ian Kemish draws on his 25-year diplomatic career in his debut novel, Two Islands, set against the backdrop of the Balkan War.

item.title: Weather sees nationwide soaking as tropical humidity reaches south-east Australia
item.description: Almost every corner of Australia will pick up rain during the next seven days, including heavy falls and pockets of flooding in multiple states.

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
item.description: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

item.title: Collision sport Run Nation Championship in Sydney sells 5,000 tickets despite head injury concerns
item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.title: Golden bandicoot numbers triple at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in Central Australia
item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.title: Meringandan collector sells vintage tractors, trucks, machines on Queensland farm
item.description: As the last man standing, 78-year-old cattleman Mervyn has parted with his collection of tractors and utes, pledging his estate to charity.

item.title: Epstein files reaffirm even a conviction doesn't taint 'good bloke' status
item.description: The rich and powerful were all too happy to stay connected to Jeffrey Epstein until it became the less convenient option.

item.title: Canberra man who murdered ex-wife in kitchen believed he had been badly treated, court hears
item.description: Disturbing new details emerge about the 2023 stabbing death of a woman in her Bruce home as her former partner faces sentencing for her murder in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: ‘Absolutely horrified’: Community left in the dark about PFAS contamination
item.description: For 25 years this waterway was polluted with toxic "forever chemicals". It was only disconnected from a major drinking supply 18 months ago.

item.description: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 is another where Russian and Belarusian athletes will be largely absent, although there are a handful competing as individual neutral athletes.

item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.description: Tiffani Phelps de Wildt died after collapsing on a remote station in WA's north. Her family says, had they known the risks, they would have tried to stop her from going out in the heat.

item.description: Athletes parade across Italy, Mariah Carey ignites a historic evening, and 'Coach Snoop' makes an appearance at the curling. Here are the quick hits from the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony.

item.description: The remarkable story of Austin Appelbee's marathon swim for help went around the world, so why did it spark such an emotional reaction?

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.title: US prosecutors seek 46-month sentence for conspiracy theorist linked to Wieambilla killers
item.description: US prosecutors are seeking a sentence of almost four years for a conspiracy theorist linked to the trio behind the Wieambilla shooting.

item.title: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley face big distances to hospital and high rates of heart condition, diabetes
item.description: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley experience high rates of preventable health conditions, hours of travel to receive basic care and limited support.

item.title: Luigi Mangione speaks out against prospect of back-to-back trials over Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: Accused killer has spoken out in court against the prospect of back-to-back trials over the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, telling a judge "it's the same trial twice".

item.title: Mayor of flood-hit Daly region accuses governments of inaction over long-term planning
item.description: The Northern Territory and federal governments are being accused of failing to plan long term to protect Indigenous communities in the Victoria Daly region.

item.title: What our teeth reveal about the growing gap between rich and poor
item.description: Teeth are one of the most visible markers of poverty: structural circumstances that are individually borne.

item.description: Almost 300 people from Daly River have been evacuated to Darwin, with just a handful of residents staying behind.

item.title: Aussie snowboarder Guseli finishes outside medals at Winter Olympics
item.description: Australia's Valentino Guseli falls short of reaching the podium in the men's snowboard big air final on day one of the Milano Cortino Winter Olympics.

item.title: Xavier Rudd on visiting Echuca, playing solo, and the spiritual being that follows him
item.description: Xavier Rudd performs solo these days, but he carries a spirit with him wherever he goes.

item.title: Big swings in Australia's electricity market have a frustrating effect on our power bills
item.description: The benefits of extremely low energy prices during the day are "washed away" by extremely high ones after dark. But there is light at the end of the tunnel.

item.title: $203 million crackdown on dodgy doctors and advocates targeting veterans
item.description: Fraudsters taking advantage of people with disability now appear to be targeting veterans, prompting a $200 million crackdown by the federal government.

item.title: After the uprising, Bangladesh returns to the ballot with its wounds still open
item.description: Bangladesh is heading back to the ballot box in what is being billed as its first free and fair election in more than a decade.

item.title: How Super Bowl half-time moments became flashpoints from the 'wardrobe malfunction' to caged kids
item.description: For a show that lasts roughly 13 minutes, the Super Bowl half-time performance has fuelled decades of conversation.

item.title: As the West wakes up to the reality of the Epstein class, China plans a global reserve currency
item.description: As the West reacts to the revelations in the latest batch of Epstein files, China has plans for the renminbi to become a global reserve currency.

item.title: Couple praise country doctors and nurses after lifesaving surgery
item.description: The barking of a dog kicks off a marathon medical effort that ends in a rare lifesaving surgery at a remote hospital.

item.title: Plane spotters call for dedicated aircraft viewing area at Adelaide Airport
item.description: Aviation enthusiasts gather at spots around Adelaide Airport to catch a glimpse of planes taking off and landing, but say it is becoming more difficult because of developments within and around the airport.

item.title: Seasonal Australian produce to make the most of in February
item.description: From grapes to red capsicum, here's how to prioritise some of this season's best fruit and veg.

item.title: Lee Lovell calls for expansion to victim of crime assistance as Queensland government makes almost $500 million in payments
item.description: The ABC can reveal the state government has paid almost $500 million to tens of thousands of victims of crime over the past three financial years.

item.title: Tasmania looks at allowing public hospital midwives to help with homebirths
item.description: The Tasmanian government is developing a public homebirth model that would allow midwives working in the public system to support women to labour from their homes.

item.title: How a Canberra-based refugee fled the Maduro regime along with millions of other Venezuelans
item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal
item.description: The Liberals and Nationals have reached a breakthrough deal to reunite the Coalition after 11th-hour talks.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: The slow death of Keir Starmer's prime ministership after Peter Mandelson's 'betrayal'
item.description: Starmer's decision to hand the plum job of UK ambassador in Washington to Lord Peter Mandelson, despite knowing Mandelson had maintained a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein well past Epstein's conviction for soliciting underage prostitution, may simply be too large an error of judgement for the public to accept.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.title: Valentino Guseli missed out on a bonus 2026 Winter Olympics medal, but won something even more important
item.description: It was 18 months ago that Valentino Guseli blew out his ACL attempting a backside 1800 at the Beijing big air. At the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard big air final, he put that ghost to rest.

item.title: 3 Doors Down frontman Brad Arnold dies after stage four cancer battle
item.description: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

item.title: Jim Chalmers says next federal budget will focus on lifting economy's 'speed limit'
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the federal government's budget in May will focus on productivity, spending restraint and tax reform.

item.title: Why young people say they are not the only ones hooked on screens
item.description: The focus of discussion around screen time is on teenagers and young adults, but young people say they are noticing older people are in the grips of their devices too.

item.title: Man dead, five others hospitalised after Sydney's Dreamstate music festival
item.description: Several people suffered "medical episodes" at the trance music festival at Sydney's Olympic Park, according to police.

item.title: New Zealanders hoped never to see the Christchurch terrorist again. Now he wants to appeal his sentence
item.description: Extraordinary arrangements are in place in Wellington, New Zealand, as a convicted terrorist prepares to address the country's Court of Appeal.

item.title: Piper James's parents say dingo management reform needed to prevent further deaths on K'gari
item.description: Piper James's parents are leaving Australia with their daughter's ashes and a determination to ensure she hasn't died in vain.

item.title: Palestine Action Group takes court action against extra police powers ahead of protests against Israeli president's Sydney visit
item.description: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

item.title: Tasmanian government says illegal tobacco sales crackdown will deliver some of the 'toughest' laws in the country
item.description: The Tasmanian government announces increased penalties for those caught selling illegal tobacco products.

item.title: WA photographers reminisce about bygone Goldfields era as gold's price surges
item.description: In 1989, two photographers travelled from Fremantle to Western Australia's Goldfields to capture the end of a gold mining era.

item.title: Police recover pilot's body from croc-infested marsh after Normanton plane crash
item.description: Police officers armed with rifles guarded their colleagues while they recovered the man's body from the crash site in difficult terrain near Normanton, in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.title: SA Liberals promise new stamp duty concessions, Labor tackles aged care bed backlog
item.description: Less than six weeks from the South Australian election, the Liberal Party has announced an election promise on stamp duty while the Labor government unveil its plan to create 1,300 new aged care beds.

item.title: Daly River flooding expected to reach 14m peak on Monday, as first damage to homes reported
item.description: Several homes in the remote community of Daly River have sustained minor flood damage, as waters continue to rise ahead of an expected 14m peak level on Monday.

item.title: Grandmother Bishnu Kumari Gurung killed as car ploughs into Perth home, family pays tribute
item.description: The family of a grandmother who died sleeping in bed when a car crashed into a Perth home pays tribute to her in an emotional press conference, after a man is charged with manslaughter.

item.title: Danish people using apps to help boycott American goods over Greenland
item.description: After Donald Trump's repeated threats to acquire Greenland, many Danish people felt powerless but new apps are helping them make choices to boycott US-made products.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn's horror crash at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games was always on the cards
item.description: Lindsey Vonn's shocking downhill crash at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games was always a possibility given the American was competing just nine days after rupturing her ACL. But it was never going to stop her from trying.

item.title: Man extradited from Dubai to Moscow over top Russian general's shooting
item.description: Lieutenant General Vladimir Alexeyev is the deputy head of Russia's vast GRU military intelligence service.

item.title: One Nation capitalises on anti-immigration sentiment in a housing crisis
item.description: Pauline Hanson might not have any substantive policies, but her rhetoric about reducing migration is clearly finding an audience.

item.title: Coalition's rushed reunification does not solve their respective branding problems
item.description: The Coalition has reunited, but the new agreement does not address underlying party tensions nor the surging fragmentation of the right.

item.title: The Tasmania Devils start selling memberships later this month — how will they work?
item.description: The Tasmania Devils will start signing up members later this month, but there's some confusion about what is required to secure a seat for AFL games in 2028. Here's how it will work.

item.title: Five simple steps to saving cash (while still having a life)
item.description: Saving money is not about beating yourself up. It's also not about depriving yourself of all sources of joy.

item.title: This week in history quiz, February 9: How well do you know the past?
item.description: Groundhog Day, an audacious art theft and a new chief mouser: how well do you remember these events?

item.title: Young people could get massive pay boost in 'totemic' wage case
item.description: "I'm paying adult fuel with still a child's wage," says Ben Walker, one of the almost half a million young people who could see a huge boost to their wage.

item.title: UK prime minister's chief of staff Morgan McSweeney quits amid Epstein fallout
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer's leadership is under threat after revelations that one of his former US ambassadors had close ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi leads coalition to landslide election victory
item.description: Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are expected to hold upwards of two-thirds of the seats in Japan's lower house.

item.title: $740m veterans plan to fund social 'rehabilitation' and psychedelic treatments for PTSD
item.description: A $740 million program will expand support for veterans and include funding for social activities such as yoga and language classes, with new treatment including MDMA and psilocybin for the worst forms of PTSD also funded for the first time.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before US Congress as Epstein files reveal more about her role
item.description: This week, Ghislaine Maxwell could be a very unwelcome distraction for Donald Trump as she appears before one of America's top political institutions.

item.title: Thailand PM Anutin Charnvirakul confident of forming government after election
item.description: South-East Asia's second-largest economy went to the polls on Sunday in a tight race between conservatives aligned with the military and the monarchy, and progressive elements represented by the reform-driven People's Party.

item.title: Investors driving up regional house prices with some buying sight unseen
item.description: Local buyers are facing stiff competition from outside investors, with regional house price rises tipped to continue.

item.title: Why Payne Haas's move from Brisbane to South Sydney changes the game for two NRL giants
item.description: Payne Haas's decision to leave Brisbane for South Sydney in 2027 didn't just shock the rugby league world, it transformed the futures of two of rugby league's most powerful clubs in an instant.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Businessman and bad gambler Sam Kanjo linked to Australia's biggest illegal tobacco fine
item.description: He's been declared bankrupt repeatedly, and was a gambling addict. Now he's linked to a $1.5 million fine for illegal tobacco.

item.title: Green turtle released from Taronga Zoo's wildlife hospital after horror injury
item.description: After surviving one of the worst fishing line injuries vet Rebecca Robey had ever seen, Terry the turtle has been set free.

item.title: Bullying surges in ACT public schools as parents, teachers speak out
item.description: Reports of bullying in ACT public schools have risen sharply in four years. Parents and teachers say children are paying the price, and the system is not coping.

item.title: Extreme heat returning for south-east Queensland before weekend showers
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

item.title: ASX jumps 1.9 per cent in $60b rally, another Optus exec sacked — as it happened
item.description: The ASX has recouped the losses of last week with a broad-based $60 billion rally.

item.title: Israeli President Isaac Herzog tells Sydney event antisemitism has been 'festering' in Australia
item.description: Isaac Herzog was invited by the governor-general and prime minister to join the Jewish community grieving the loss of life in the December 14 massacre of mostly Jewish Australians at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: Mother claims missed warning signs in NT hospital led to baby's lifelong disabilities
item.description: Mia Pilbrow is taking legal action against a Northern Territory hospital and calling for the territory to adopt tailored pre-term labour guidelines, after medical staff sent her home seven times during her pregnancy, repeatedly assuring her the baby was fine.

item.title: As AFL prepares to reboot State of Origin, there are hopes it can capture the imagination of a new generation
item.description: The AFL is about to reboot the State of Origin concept, with the clash between Western Australia and Victoria at Perth Stadium next Saturday — on Valentine's Day — set to show if there's any love left for the idea.

item.title: Explain the Internet: Why Wuthering Heights is one of the year's most controversial adaptations
item.description: Days away from the release of Emerald Fennell's highly anticipated adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic novel, critics and fans alike are still fighting about text fidelity in the comments.

item.title: Deua River Valley and Cobargo still rebuilding six years after Black Summer bushfires
item.description: Residents who lived through the 2019-20 bushfires on the NSW South Coast say this summer's fires triggered traumatic memories, and highlighted the recovery and resilience projects that remain unfinished.

item.title: Liberals despair at prospect of 'non-existence' and weigh leadership change after catastrophic Newspoll
item.description: Sussan Ley could face a challenge to her leadership from Angus Taylor this week after a disastrous opinion poll showed the Coalition parties falling further behind One Nation.

item.title: Aussie stars as Seahawks use ferocious defence to claim Super Bowl win
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks overawe the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LX as punter Michael Dickson becomes the second ever Australian NFL champion.

item.description: Tasmanian minister Nick Duigan will take extended medical leave to undergo heart surgery, the state government has announced.

item.description: A study has found increasing "punitive" bail law amendments are negatively affecting First Nations people.

item.description: Thousands of people have gathered across Australia as a protest over Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit begins. Follow live.

item.title: Darkwaves research allows scientists to measure impact of 'underwater blackouts' on marine life
item.description: For the first time a group of international scientists have measured the impact of what happens to marine life when the lights go out underwater.

item.title: Backyard pods won't fix the housing crisis but they signal a shift
item.description: Australia's biggest hardware retailer has started selling tiny homes. Are backyard pods the answer to a national housing crisis?

item.description: Women's rights activist Narges Mohammadi is sentenced to a further six years in jail.

item.title: HESTA CEO Debby Blakey resigns after superannuation administration outage
item.description: HESTA's boss is calling it quits after 11 years in the role. Her exit follows an outage that left members unable to access their accounts.

item.description: Lindsey Vonn's 2026 Winter Olympic Games ended in disaster, but her teammates and rivals have heaped praise on the three-time Olympic medallist.

item.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
item.description: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

item.title: Christchurch terrorist gives testimony in NZ appeal court as he attempts to vacate guilty pleas over 2019 attack
item.description: The convicted Christchurch terrorist and murderer is giving testimony in the New Zealand Court of Appeal as he seeks to vacate his guilty pleas over his 2019 attack on two mosques.

item.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in landmark case
item.description: Jimmy Lai, one of Hong Kong's most outspoken critics of China, has learned his fate after being sentenced this morning.

item.title: Independent inquiry launched into NACC chief's handling of defence ties
item.description: The body responsible for holding the federal integrity watchdog to account will formally investigate it for agency maladministration and its chief, Paul Brereton, for officer misconduct.

item.title: Mitchell Freeway head-on crash in Butler leaves two dead after ute driven on wrong side of road
item.description: A 56-year-old-woman and a 24-year-old man are dead after a head-on collision involving a utility that was being driven on the wrong side of the Mitchell Freeway in Perth's north.

item.title: Rain brings relief and road closures after record heatwave in South Australia
item.description: High rainfall in north-eastern South Australia brings some relief for pastoralists after record-breaking heat, with a reprieve expected for metropolitan Adelaide this week.

item.title: Five simple, tasty vegetarian recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays
item.description: Looking to add some more vegetarian dishes to your weekly rotation? We have you covered with these five recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays.

item.title: Queensland coroner hears father showed no concern for children caught in fatal house fire
item.description: An inquest has started probing a fatal house fire, with a coroner tasked with trying to determine what sparked it and whether either parent may have been involved.

item.title: NFL Super Bowl LX quick hits: Mack Hollins dresses as a prisoner, Bad Bunny hosts a wedding and Michael Dickson's punts help Seattle Seahawks win
item.description: The most important match of the NFL season crowns a champion, but also provides eye-catching moments on and off the field. Here are five quick hits from Super Bowl LX.

item.title: Dimitri D'Elio, Kylie Stott jailed for Christmas Eve killing of Charlie Gander in Bunbartha, Victoria
item.description: Charlie Gander’s body was found in a burnt-out car on a country road on Christmas Eve, 2022. Today, two people were sentenced to a combined 36 years in prison over his death.

item.title: Family rallies to save pets left behind in Daly River flood evacuation
item.description: When hundreds of people evacuated the Daly River community due to flooding, most had to leave their pets behind. But a nearby family swung into action to help.

item.description: Global superstar Bad Bunny performs at the Super Bowl LX, sharing the stage with surprise guests Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin, while a couple weds on stage.

item.description: Billionaire chief executive says the company will shift its focus from Mars and the project could be achieved within 10 years.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds announces retirement at end of NRL season
item.description: Adam Reynolds will finish his stellar career at the end of the season after fulfilling his Broncos mission to perfection.

item.description: Flooding at the Daly River community is expected to surpass the major flood level late Monday, with a peak of 14.1 metres expected by Tuesday afternoon.

item.description: Rain across central Australia has been welcomed at cattle stations, but flooding and road damage have cut off some remote communities.

item.title: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright fined $10k for landing helicopter in backyard

item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.description: Holly Harris and Jason Chan will become the first Aussies in 12 years to represent the country in ice dancing, while Tess Coady and Meila Stalker will compete in the big air final. Follow live.
